english: very; quite; much; to a large extent

etymology.description: Semantic: 彳(彳) (chì, "step") + Phonetic: 艮(艮) (gèn, "stopping") = very -> to a large extent
etymology.interpretation: The character 很(hěn) combines 彳(彳) (chì, "step"), suggesting movement or continuation, with 艮(艮) (gèn, "stopping"), which provides the pronunciation. This juxtaposition reflects something significant—hence the meaning 'very' or 'to a large extent.'

examples.chinese: 今天很热(今天很熱)，我们很享受夏天(我們很享受夏天)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān hěn rè, wǒmen hěn xiǎngshòu xiàtiān.
examples.english: It is very hot today, and we really enjoy the summer.
